{"step_by_step_thinking": "Schedule H, G, X, and M are all classifications of drugs under the Drugs and Cosmetics Act in India. Schedule H drugs are prescription drugs that must be sold by retail only on production of a prescription by a registered medical practitioner. Schedule G drugs are over-the-counter drugs that can be sold without a prescription. Schedule X drugs are narcotic and psychotropic substances, which require a special license to sell and also a prescription. Schedule M pertains to the manufacturing practices for pharmaceutical products. Therefore, the drug that must be sold by retail only on production of a prescription by a registered medical practitioner is a Schedule H drug.", "answer_choice": "A"}
